      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        Returns the time that is setted for the request.
        Returns:
        A String with the time

      • setTime

        public void setTime(java.lang.String time)
        Sets the time for the request. Format should be passed as follows:
        [YYYY]-[MM]-[DD]T[HH]:[MM]:[SS]{+,-}[HH][MM]
        The last {+,-}[HH][MM] is the timezone
        Example:
        [2013-05-06T12:00:00-0400]
        For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Parameters:
        time - in the described format

      • getExcludeURL

        public java.lang.String getExcludeURL()
        Returns the excluded fields that are setted for the request.
        Returns:
        A String with the fields excluded

      • setExcludeURL

        public void setExcludeURL(java.lang.String excludeURL)
        Sets the fields to be excluded in the request.
        Format should be as follows:
        [field1,field2,fieldN] with no spaces For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Parameters:
        excludeURL - in the described format

      • isExtend

        public boolean isExtend()
        Returns if the hourly report should be extended in the request.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • setExtend

        public void setExtend(boolean extend)
        Sets if the hourly report should be extended in the request. For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Parameters:
        extend -

      • offsetValue

        public int offsetValue()
        Returns the timezone offset in an integer For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Returns:
        integer with the offset

      • offset

        public java.lang.String offset()
        Returns the offset as a String with '+' or '-' sign. For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Returns:
        String with the offset

      • getUnits

        public java.lang.String getUnits()
        Returns the units that are setted in the request.
        Returns:
        String with the units setted

      • setUnits

        public void setUnits(java.lang.String units)
        Sets the units to be passed in the request. If the units are unavailable, auto is setted.
        Units can be setted with constants like ForecastIO.UNITS_AUTO. For more information refer to the API Docs: https://developer.forecast.io
        Parameters:
        units -
